ygData.subject: RE: Sonorous Clouding message
ygData.msgSnippet: No all 3 times they were plain ol Ice Goblins, and I saw the Eye icon blink just before they saw me and attacked. I know the Elites and some of the high level
ygData.messageBody:
No all 3 times they were plain ol Ice Goblins, and I saw the Eye icon blink
just before they saw me and attacked. I know the Elites and some of the high
level Gobs can see me but the wizards, mendicants, priests , so-called
common spawn cant.


-----Original Message-----
From: Steven S. Klug [mailto:sklug@...]
Sent: Tuesday, August 31, 1999 11:05 AM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Sonorous Clouding message


From: "Steven S. Klug" <sklug@...>

I have noticed that with the preponderance of casters in Permafrost, some
of them can see through invisible. Make sure this is not what you're
experiencing.


At 10:54 AM 8/31/99 -0700, you wrote:
>From: "Chris Kuenster (Entex)" <v-ntxck@...>
>
>No I spend a huge ammount of time invisible and I have noticed the
opposite.
>I have been seen on numerous occasions where I blink into view. Its scarin
>the crap out of me. I was seen 3 times in less than an hour this morning in
>Permafrost, fortunately I had my Jboots activated and had the speed to get
>to the zone. My skill in Wind is 200, I maxed it a few days ago. I use
invis
>to navigate all sorts of places in upper and lower Guk, and Permafrost. I
>always used to disband from my party just so I wouldnt have to worry about
>my Invis fading on me because it was always 100% reliable before this last
>patch. Now I dont know anymore, at least I know the caster Invis is going
to
>work a little while.
>
>-----Original Message-----
>From: kim@... [mailto:kim@...]
>Sent: Tuesday, August 31, 1999 10:45 AM
>To: eqbards@onelist.com
>Subject: [eqbards] Sonorous Clouding message
>
>
>From: <kim@...>
>
>Did anyone else notice the "you feel as if you are about to
>become visible" message with invisibility? Of course Clouding
>pulsed again before I became visible. I have to wonder if
>this fix (message 5 sec before invisibility blinks off) didn't
>just make Clouding 100% reliable...
>
>--
>John H. Kim
>kim@...
>
